intro: Nemesia euryceras, commonly known as the broad-leafed nemesia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are clustered in racemes. Nemesia euryceras is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
